Posts.Content: Hi! I am Patty an I am a newby to this board. I had breast cancer the first time in my r breast, 5 years later in my left breast. At that point I had to bi-lateral mastectomy and a hysterectomy. Last summer I was diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer to my bones. It started with a sharp pain in my upper back. I now go monthly for Zometa for my bones and a hormonal injection for the cancer  (i can never remember the name of it). Overall my health is ok, except for the aches and pains that go along with it. Oh, it's also in my liver. The liver has improved as well as my lesions. I just try to live on day at a time. If you want to be friends, send me a request. I am a great listener! God Bless You All!
Posts.Title: diagnoised with stage iv breast cancer metastasized to bones in spine and pelvic

Posts.Title: diagnoised with stage iv breast cancer metastasized to bones in spine and pelvic

Posts.Content: While bein treated for my first two rounds of breast cancer, I did have pain in my long bones, the arms and legs. About a week after the treatment they felt better.  I know everyone is different, but they warned me up front about this. I hope this helps. God Bless you! Patty
Posts.Title: leg and knee pain during chemo
